Detailed Description

MandelThread class.

Handles the calculation of a single row of the mandelbrot set.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MandelThread::MandelThread ( wxEvtHandler *  pParent,
int  row,
double &  xmint,
double &  xmaxt,
double &  ymint,
double &  ymaxt,
int &  widtht,
int &  heightt,
int &  max 
)

MandelThread Constructor.

Parameters:
pParent A pointer to the parent object that will handle the events produced by this thread.
row The row index of the row to be rendered.
xmint The minimum mathematical x-value of the viewing window.
xmaxt The maximum mathematical x-value of the viewing window.
ymint The minimum mathematical y-value of the viewing window.
ymaxt The maximum mathematical y-value of the viewing window.
widtht The width, in pixels, of the viewing window.
heightt The height, in pixels, of the viewing window.
max The maximum number of iterations per pixel.
Transfers necessary information to the thread for calculating a row.

Member Function Documentation

unsigned char * MandelThread::DrawMandelRow (  )  [private]

Calculates a single row of the Mandelbrot Set.

Returns:
An array of unsigned char values representing RGB pixel data

void * MandelThread::Entry (  )  [private]

Called when the thread's path of execution is entered.

Creates a wxCommandEvent of type wxEVT_MTHREAD, calls functions to calculate the row, and passes that data back through the event system.

unsigned char * MandelThread::getColour ( double  iter  )  [private]

Generates the necessary color for a pixel based on iteration count.

Returns:
A 3 unsigned char long array of pixel data representing an RGB color. Consider replacing with wxWidgets code if benchmarks prove it more efficient.
